summary: Genesis, an English rock band, formed in 1967 at Charterhouse School. Their classic lineup, including Tony Banks, Mike Rutherford, Peter Gabriel, Phil Collins, and Steve Hackett, became famous for progressive rock. After some member changes, the band achieved great success with albums like "Selling England by the Pound" and "Invisible Touch." They sold over 100 million albums and won a Grammy. Genesis was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2010, leaving a lasting impact on music.
title: Genesis (band)
